intro: Jurtsevia, commonly known as the golden sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly found in Kazakhstan and surrounding areas. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, succulent stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Jurtsevia thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Its botanical features make it an important species for studying plant adaptations to harsh environments.
